title: Modal Verbs for Speculation & Deduction
description: Learn to make guesses and draw conclusions about present and past situations.

rules.title: Must/Can't for Present Deductions
rules.explanation: Use 'must' when you are almost certain something is true based on evidence. Use 'can't/cannot' when you are almost certain something is not true.
rules.structure: must/can't + base verb (present) | must/can't + be + -ing (present continuous)

examples.sentence: She must be exhausted. She's been working 12-hour shifts all week.
examples.translation: 그녀는 분명 지쳐있을 거야. 일주일 내내 12시간 교대 근무를 했거든.

examples.sentence: He can't be serious about resigning. He just got promoted!
examples.translation: 그가 사직하겠다는 게 진심일 리가 없어. 방금 승진했잖아!

examples.sentence: They must be having problems with the project. They've missed two deadlines.
examples.translation: 그들은 분명 프로젝트에 문제가 있을 거야. 마감을 두 번이나 놓쳤잖아.

rules.title: May/Might/Could for Present Possibility
rules.explanation: Use 'may', 'might', or 'could' when something is possible but you are not certain. 'Might' and 'could' suggest slightly less certainty than 'may'.

examples.sentence: She might be looking for a new job. She's updated her LinkedIn profile.
examples.translation: 그녀는 새 직장을 찾고 있을지도 몰라. 링크드인 프로필을 업데이트했거든.

examples.sentence: The company could be planning layoffs. There have been closed-door meetings.
examples.translation: 회사가 해고를 계획하고 있을 수도 있어. 비밀 회의가 있었거든.

examples.sentence: He may not know about the changes yet. He was on vacation.
examples.translation: 그는 아직 변경 사항을 모를 수도 있어. 휴가 중이었거든.

rules.title: Must Have/Can't Have for Past Deductions
rules.explanation: Use 'must have' + past participle for certainty about the past. Use 'can't have' + past participle when you're certain something didn't happen.

examples.sentence: She must have impressed them in the interview. She got the job immediately.
examples.translation: 그녀는 분명 면접에서 인상을 남겼을 거야. 바로 채용됐잖아.

examples.sentence: He can't have finished the report already. He only started an hour ago.
examples.translation: 그가 벌써 보고서를 끝냈을 리 없어. 한 시간 전에 시작했는데.

examples.sentence: They must have worked all night to meet the deadline.
examples.translation: 그들은 마감을 맞추기 위해 밤새 일했음에 틀림없어.

rules.title: May Have/Might Have/Could Have for Past Possibility
rules.explanation: Use 'may have', 'might have', or 'could have' + past participle when you think something possibly happened in the past but you're not sure.
rules.structure: may have/might have/could have + past participle

examples.sentence: She might have misunderstood the instructions. That would explain the mistake.
examples.translation: 그녀가 지시를 잘못 이해했을 수도 있어. 그게 실수를 설명해 주겠네.

examples.sentence: The manager could have forgotten about our meeting. He seems very busy.
examples.translation: 매니저가 우리 회의를 잊어버렸을 수도 있어. 매우 바빠 보이거든.

examples.sentence: They may not have received the email. The server was down yesterday.
examples.translation: 그들이 이메일을 못 받았을 수도 있어. 어제 서버가 다운됐거든.

rules.title: Should/Ought to for Expectation
rules.explanation: Use 'should' or 'ought to' when you expect something to be true based on logic or evidence. Use 'should have' for past expectations.
rules.structure: should/ought to + base verb | should have + past participle

examples.sentence: The interview should be starting now. It was scheduled for 10 AM.
examples.translation: 면접이 지금 시작해야 해. 오전 10시로 예정되어 있었거든.

examples.sentence: She ought to be qualified for the promotion. She's been here five years.
examples.translation: 그녀는 승진 자격이 있을 거야. 5년째 여기 있잖아.

examples.sentence: They should have arrived by now. The flight landed two hours ago.
examples.translation: 그들은 지금쯤 도착했어야 해. 비행기가 두 시간 전에 착륙했거든.

rules.title: Speculation in Professional Contexts
rules.explanation: In workplace situations, modal verbs help express uncertainty diplomatically while making professional assessments.

examples.sentence: The delay could be due to technical issues. We should check with IT.
examples.translation: 지연은 기술적 문제 때문일 수 있어요. IT에 확인해 봐야겠어요.

examples.sentence: He must have had a good reason for leaving early. He's usually very dedicated.
examples.translation: 그가 일찍 퇴근한 데는 분명 타당한 이유가 있을 거예요. 보통 매우 성실하거든요.

examples.sentence: The project might not be completed on time if we don't get more resources.
examples.translation: 더 많은 자원을 확보하지 못하면 프로젝트가 제시간에 완료되지 않을 수도 있어요.

exercises.question: She's been in meetings all day. She _____ exhausted.
He got the promotion so quickly. He _____ (impress) the directors at the interview.
I'm not sure why she's late. She _____ stuck in traffic.
He only started learning to code last month. He _____ (finish) the project already. It's too complex.
The client hasn't responded to our proposal. They _____ still be considering it.
I don't know why she declined the offer. She _____ (have) personal reasons.
The results _____ ready by now. We submitted the tests a week ago.

exercises.instruction: Rewrite using a modal of deduction
exercises.original: I'm almost certain she accepted the job offer.
exercises.answer: She must have accepted the job offer.

exercises.question: He _____ (work) on weekends. That's why he always looks so tired on Mondays.
She wasn't at her desk when I called. She _____ to lunch.
